title: Brooch And Pendant, "Venus and Cupids", ca. 1880
creditline: Gift of the estate and in memory of Robert B. Noyes
description: A: the brooch, with an enamel painting showing a woman with a putto in a gold frame with nine pendants of five lengths at the bottom.  The frame of the blocks is covered with blocks, balls, arches and three-lobed forms on the pendants of hearts and flowers.  B: is a sheath with ring which slips on the pin of the brooch, transforming it into a locket.  Forms a set with 1946-50-24ab.

exhibitions.title: Jewelry: A Selection from the Cooper-Hewitt Collection
